notes.3.65.0:
New features:

* Add --format=plain option for table commands. This produces TSV-like output, 
  but with no quoting or escaping, to make most output easier to process with 
  basic command-line tools such as cut and grep. Literal tabs and newlines are 
  replaced by a space.

Other changes:

* Rename the backup --unsafe option to --live
  (This tones down the warning level on making such a backup)
* Remove the restriction on deleting the main environment
* Remove us-2 from available region examples
notes.3.66.0:
* Use the 'http://' scheme instead of 'solr://' for Solr service URLs.
* Add a --default-branch option to the project:create command.
* Make the default API request timeout configurable through an env var.
  PLATFORMSH_CLI_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT will override the default of 30 (seconds).
notes.3.67.0:
New features (which depend on the upcoming API version 12):

* Support build-time environment-level variables.
* Some support for environment types (see note below):
  - Add the type in the `environment:list` (`env`) command.
  - Mention the type in the environment label.
  - Add a `--type` option to the `push` command.
  - Add a `--type` option to the `branch` command.
  - Allow the type to be modified in the `env:info` command.

> Note: user commands (such as `user:add` and `user:update`) do not yet support
environment types. They will in a future version. The API is backwards
compatible: if your project supports environment types, and you change a user's
role on an environment, it will change their role on all environments of that
type.

Other changes:

* Support new `/users/me` API in the `auth:info` command.
* Fix `user:update` to avoid recalculating environment access changes while they are made.
notes.3.68.0:
New features:

* Add environment types support to the user commands.

Other changes:

* Rework `environment:delete --merged` to not require a local Git repository.
* Refresh the cache if a specified environment is not found in the `environment:delete` command.
* Fix duplicates when listing multiple activity statuses.
notes.3.69.0:
New features:

* Add support for Organizations.
  This is disabled by default, unless enabled in `config.yaml` (`api.organizations`)
  or in an environment variable (`PLATFORMSH_CLI_API_ORGANIZATIONS`).

Other changes:

* Fix inviting a user to a project with an environment type permission.
* When cloning an empty project via the `project:get` (`get`) command,
  initialize with the correct default branch name, rather than `master`.
* Remove Commands section in README.
  This was already too long, and Organizations support adds many extra commands.
notes.3.69.2: * Enable use of the organizations API by default
notes.3.70.0:
* Add org:curl hidden utility command
* Improve labelling for org:user:get
notes.3.71.0:
New features:
* Allow updates to multiple properties on organization billing addresses

Other changes:
* Add detailed help to the ssh-cert:load command
* Update client library to fix handling of project invitation conflicts
* Remove references to Hipchat
* Ignore 400 errors from getCurrentDeployment() in drush-aliases command
notes.3.72.1: * Display the organization in the projects list.
notes.3.72.2: * Don't generate an alias for an inactive DG2 target (#1093)
notes.3.73.0:
New features:

* Add a hidden `env:curl` command to make raw requests to the current environment's API.
* Add pagination to the `projects` (`project:list`) command.
  Also add a new optional `created_at` column.
* Allow unsetting the remote project in the `project:set-remote` command (`project:set-remote -`).

Other changes:

* Warn when an API token is set on the container.
* Remove workaround for an older PHP pcre.jit bug (fixed since PHP 7.3.11).
* Add delimiter to read environment variables over SSH without pollution from other messages.
* Fix TypeError in domain:add command error handling in PHP 8+ (#1097).
* Search the docs site directly for the `docs` command.
notes.3.73.1: * Show release notes for each version on update
notes.3.73.2: * Support "require" and "repositories" keys for PHP dependencies
notes.3.74.0:
* Add `org:create` and `org:delete` commands (marked as beta/alpha for now).
* Add `auth:info id --no-auto-login` as a convenience for scripts to check if already logged in.
notes.3.75.0:
New features:
* Add `repo:read` (`read`) command to read a file or directory in the project's
  hosted Git repository (combining `repo:ls` and `repo:cat`).

Other changes:
* Use `composer/ca-bundle` to find a CA bundle automatically (for TLS
  certificate verification on systems without a CA bundle configured).
* Avoid prompting to create an SSH config file, if the file is not writable.
* Avoid printing all release notes when upgrading from a dev version
* Allow using the cache for finding an environment by machine name.
* Print default environment/organization selection to STDERR.
notes.3.75.1: * Add the bundled cacert.pem to the phar build
notes.3.75.2:
* Use Composer's CA bundle detection in additional places:
  - the credential helper download
  - the self-updater (`up` command)
  - the installer script (detection only, without the fallback bundle)
notes.3.75.3: * Fix ConsoleLogger TypeError in Api class due to null stdErr property
notes.3.76.0:
* Add country support to org:create and org:info commands.
* Make the org:create and org:delete commands visible in the list.
notes.3.76.1:
* Fetch organization-specific plans and regions lists when creating a project.
  This fixes a "Multiple organizations found" error when the user owns more
  than one organization.
* Suppress browser stderr messages unless in `-vv` or debug mode.
notes.3.76.2:
* Fix auto login in interactive mode  
  Auto login was unintentionally disabled in v3.76.1 via a bug in the regions API changes.
notes.3.77.0:
### `backup:list` (`backups`) command changes

This command now uses the backups API for listing backups, rather than the
activities API. The result is that deleted backups will no longer be listed
(avoiding confusion), and the output changes slightly.

Old version example:

    +---------------------------+----------------+----------+----------+---------+
    | Created                   | Backup name    | Progress | State    | Result  |
    +---------------------------+----------------+----------+----------+---------+
    | 2022-02-01T00:00:00+00:00 | abcdefgh123456 | 100%     | complete | success |
    +---------------------------+----------------+----------+----------+---------+

New version example:

    +---------------------------+----------------+-------------+
    | Created                   | Backup ID      | Restorable  |
    +---------------------------+----------------+-------------+
    | 2022-02-01T00:00:00+00:00 | abcdefgh123456 | true        |
    +---------------------------+----------------+-------------+

New available `--columns` names: `created_at`, `id`, `restorable`, `expires_at`, `commit_id`, `index`, `safe`

Deprecated options (which no longer have an effect): `--limit`, `--start`
Deprecated column names (which no longer show data): `progress`, `state`, `result`
notes.3.78.0:
New features:

* Display some more information about regions in the project:create command, 
  including the datacenter's location, provider and carbon intensity.
* Improve environment:delete command:
  - Add --type and --exclude-type options
  - Include environment(s) when --inactive or --merged are specified
  - Split the environment value by commas, in the 'environment' argument
  - Make the reason for environments being found clearer
  - Handle all environment statuses

Other changes:

* Improve error for empty environments in repo: commands.
* Use the organizations API more consistently in the subscription:info command.
* Sort the result in the backup:list (backups) command.
notes.3.79.0:
New features:

* Add an `--exclude-type` option when listing activities, and support multiple
  types in `--type`.

Other changes:

* Fix too many API calls in `backup:restore` command when finding a backup by name
* Fix activity pagination skipping items created at the same second (add microseconds support).
notes.3.79.1: * Fix error in activity commands: "The value of option --type is not an array"
notes.3.79.2: * Fix 'The "incomplete" option does not exist' in the integration:activities command
notes.3.79.3:
* Fix organization support in the `project:delete` command.
  Removes the now inaccurate advice, "Only the project's owner can delete it".
* Fix wildcard matching for environment IDs that contain a slash (`/`).
  Affected commands: `environment:delete` and `user:add`.
* Print the current environment in the `environment:delete` command.
notes.3.79.4:
* Handle the "cancelled" state in the `activity:log` command.
* Allow manual override of the region ID in the `project:create` command.
* Always use the API gateway URL ("external API proxy") when configured.
* Error when a conditional field is used in the wrong context.
  For example, when the `--fetch-branches` option is used with the `webhook`
  integration type, previously it would have been silently ignored, now it
  will fail with an error message.
  Affected commands:
  `integration:add`, `integration:update`, `variable:create`, `variable:update`
* Allow pagination to be disabled in the `project:list` (`projects`) command.
  Pagination for this command can be disabled using an environment variable:

        export PLATFORMSH_CLI_PAGINATION_ENABLED=0

    or by adding the following to `$HOME/.platformsh/config.yaml`:

        pagination:
          enabled: false
* Return a 0 exit code from `environment:delete` if no error occurred.
notes.3.79.5:
* Fix: "pagination" section in config.yaml could not override the default
* Fix potentially not using the cache when a project hostname is known
* Fix "Call to a member function setApiUrl() on bool"
notes.3.79.6: * Update client to fix SSH URL problem introduced in v3.79.4.
notes.3.79.7:
* Fix an additional bug introduced in v3.79.4: the activity log ending abruptly
  without refreshing the activity state.
* Avoid errors caused by invalid config when processing environment variables.
notes.3.79.8:
* Add --if-exists to pg_dump, in the db:dump command, so that PostgreSQL dump
  files can be restored without errors on an empty database.
* Avoid matching "-" as an environment ID when parsing a Console URL.
* Fix legacy region detection in the backup:restore command, preventing
  accidental restore to the wrong environment on such regions.
notes.3.80.0:
* Support the `--shared-key` option for `webhook` as well as `health.webhook`
  integrations.
* Fix SSL chain validation for files containing multiple certificates.
* Improvements to the `environment:delete` command:
  - Only select the current environment if nothing else is specified.
    This may change behavior for existing scripts if they expect the
    currently checked-out environment to be always selected for deletion.
  - Avoid asking twice about deleting the same environment.
  - Add an `--only-type` option, to enforce only deleting environments of
    one or more types, e.g.

        platform env:delete --merged --only-type development
notes.3.80.1:
* Fix inverted --exclude in the environment:delete command
  (a bug introduced in v3.80.0)
notes.3.80.2:
* Filter by organization (`--org`) without needing direct access, in the
  `project:list` (`projects`) command.
* Display the simpler version of the project directory in the `project:get`
  (`get`) command.
notes.3.80.3:
* Translate environment ID to type when adding or changing a user.  
  Since around 1 year ago with the introduction of environment types, users
  should be given roles on the environment type, not on a specific environment
  ID. For those still using environment IDs, the CLI now translates these to
  types on the client side (before the API call), for more clarity in the
  output and when later listing project invitations.
* Remove support for projects which do not have environment types (such
  projects no longer exist).

More information on environment types: https://docs.platform.sh/administration/users.html#environment-types
notes.3.81.0:
New features:

* Add `--no-warn` (`-W`) and `--header` (`-H`) options to the `auth:token` command.
* Add `--json` option to curl commands.
* Return a success (zero) exit code from `self:update` if there is no update.

Other changes:

* Fix "Property defined twice" error in the `org:billing:address` command.
* Clarify no organization message in `project:create` (`create`) command.
* Remove more now unnecessary checks for environment types.
    Improves performance in `environment:list` (`env`) command.
* Fix example for `user:get --level environment`.
notes.3.81.1:
* Fix: automatic update prompt not saving last check time if there is no update
* Remove mbstring requirement from README and installer
* Add environment.domain activities to the type filter
* Allow use of --json option with lower curl versions
notes.3.82.0:
* Support pagination in the `organization:subscriptions` command.
  Add `--page` and `--count` (`-c`) options. A `0` count disables pagination.
* Adapt the `project:list` (`projects`) command for consistency:
  - Specifying a `--page` will work even if pagination had been otherwise disabled.
  - Remove terminal height detection, instead making the "items per page" count
    a configuration parameter defaulting to 20 items, overridden by `--count`.
* Clarify environment variables when the home directory cannot be detected.
* Remove now unnecessary webhook code in `integration` commands, fixing a bug
  where source code integration webhooks were added with the incorrect URL.
notes.3.82.1:
* Improve pagination description in the `org:sub` command.
* Clarify `--my` option in `project:list` (`projects`) for organizations.
* Add `integration.health.webhook` activity type.
* Fix `commit:list` (`commits`) to respect `--limit` for commits with
  multiple parents.
* Replace templated values when installing shell config files. This only
  affects alternative configurations, e.g. dev builds.
notes.3.82.2:
* Display the error from Xcode in the project:get (get) command
* Clarify "switch remote" vs "set remote" in the project:create (create) command
* Fix env:delete command to respect --no-delete-branch in interactive mode
notes.3.83.0:
New features:

* Add --instance (-I) option to SSH commands.

Other changes:

* Disable the credential helper when running in a snap (e.g. an IDE on Ubuntu),
  as it appears to work inconsistently (reading yet not writing).
* Allow interactive choice of workers for SSH to Dedicated environments.
* Rework fetching projects
    - Separate project "stub" from full project representations to avoid using the
      stub information accidentally. Fixes inconsistent marking a user as the
      project "owner" in the users:list (users) command.
    - Fixes the validation error when asked for a project ID interactively.
notes.3.83.1: * Quick fix for: 'The "instance" option does not exist' in tunnel commands
notes.3.84.0:
New features:

* Add support for third-party log forwarding integrations (API availability
  depends on the project): newrelic, sumologic, splunk, and syslog.
* Add metrics:disk-usage (disk) command.

Other changes:

* Use the API URL consistently to fetch a project even if a direct hostname is
  supplied. This deprecates the `--host` option (the option is still there but
  will be ignored).
* Bump composer/ca-bundle from 1.3.3 to 1.3.4 (#1170).
* Disable docker credential helper inside a container (where it does not work).
* Ensure Drush alias names only contain allowed characters. This fixes aliases
  for environment names containing a slash.
* Find the correct app's SSH URL when no instance or default is given.
notes.3.84.1: * Fix integration:create command: auth_token and auth_mode are only for syslog integrations
notes.3.84.2:
* Hide unavailable integrations (per project) in the integration:create command
* Simplify prompts for the syslog and other log integrations
* Add clarity to the --yes flag in help
notes.3.85.0:
* Accept multiple arguments in the "multi" command. This means that the command
  to run multiple times can be specified after -- without needing to use
  quotes.
* Fix listing custom schema (database) names for postgresql in the db:dump command.
* Fix PHP 5.6 incompatibility in the db:size command.
* Fix Dedicated environment detection in the logs command.
* Fix inconsistency between -e and --environment in the variable:create command.
notes.3.86.0:
* Improve default options and their documentation:
  - Add a `--no-interaction` option (to match Symfony Console defaults a little
  more closely), with the same meaning as enabling the `PLATFORMSH_CLI_NO_INTERACTION`
  environment variable: disable interaction and pick the default answer to
  questions. The existing `--yes` (`-y`) option is similar in meaning and now
  the same in effect; the answer "yes" has been made the default for all
  confirmation questions.
  - Hide deprecated options from command help (still with no error if they are
  used). This includes `--no` (`-n`), which can be confused with `--no-interaction`
  though it is subtly different: it answers "no" to all confirmation questions,
  and picks the default answer for other questions. This also restores `--ansi`
  and `--no-ansi` as hidden options; they are present by default in Symfony
  Console but were previously omitted from this CLI for simplicity.
  - See `platform help [cmd]` for more information.
* Improve the git tree cache for commands such as `read`.
* Show the `disk` command in the list.
* Two fixes to the `multi` command:
    - Fix dialog-based project selection (previously resulting in 0 projects)
    - Fix non-interactive use: e.g. the `-y` flag now works for the parent and
      child commands independently.
notes.3.86.1:
* Avoid a TypeError when reading invalid applications.yaml configuration
* Clarify activity cannot be cancelled error
* Fix "multi" command exiting after the first project
notes.3.87.0:
* Integrate with the phone number verification API:
  - Check if phone number verification is required in the
    `project:create` (`create`) command.
  - Add an `auth:verify-phone-number` command to verify the number
    interactively.
notes.3.87.1: * Refresh phone verification status after verifying
notes.3.88.0:
* Add support for automatic "self-installation" of shell configuration files.
* Fix auto-login (broken in v3.87.0).
notes.3.88.1:
* Avoid the self-install prompt in more situations:
  - In all cases where the self:install command previously exited successfully.
  - If environment variables are set:
    `PLATFORMSH_CLI_APPLICATION_PROMPT_SELF_INSTALL=0` or `PLATFORMSH_CLI_WRAPPED=1`
